abstract: A Pentagon official acted after a report said the F-35 fighter jet was so far behind schedule that it could cost $16.6 billion more than expected.
snippet: A Pentagon official acted after a report said the F-35 fighter jet was so far behind schedule that it could cost $16.6 billion more than expected.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon’s top acquisition official said on Monday that Lockheed Martin, the prime contractor for the new F-35 fighter jet, would have to cover part of the increased costs of the huge program.

headline.main: U.S. Says Lockheed Must Pay Part of F-35 Cost Overruns
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Lockheed Must Pay Part of F-35 Cost Overruns

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
